title: Artist Rachel Feinstein’s Favorite Things
text: “The feathers signify my mother, who’s passionate about saving the wild parrots of South Florida—where I grew up—from poachers. I don’t understand my mother’s obsession with parrots. They frighten me. The photo is of my dad walking me down the aisle at my wedding, on Valentine’s Day, 1998. He just passed away. He was a dermatologist, so my pale skin has aged pretty well thanks to him. Those are shells of oysters that John [Currin, her artist husband] and I ate at Masa, the Japanese restaurant in New York that we go to for our wedding anniversary every year. Inside one shell is a 100-carat blue aquamarine ring that John...
description: The painter and sculptor shares the personal objects that inspire her most, including a 100-carat ring her husband, artist John Currin, once gave her
